result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett S Bowar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CM394 & 16CM418 called together at 1:50pm [ma]
Defendant Brett S Bowar in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2 of Case 15CM394 and Count #2 of Case 16CM418; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #1 of Case 15CM394 and Count#1 of Case 16CM418

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

As to Case 15CM394, Count #2 The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; consecutive to any previously imposed sentence, to commence on   1/13/17 at 6:00pm
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Bowar is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443
--to submit DNA sample

As to Case 16CM418, Count #2 The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to sentence in 15CM394.
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443
--to pay drug testing fee in the amount of $240, joint and several with co-actors 
--to sumbit DNA sample 

The total of Cases 15CM394 and 16CM418 are to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 3/31/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 15  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
